intro: Chaetolimon, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, cylindrical stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chaetolimon is often found in sandy soils and can thrive with minimal water, making it a resilient plant in desert ecosystems.
